name: Reverse Preacher Curl (Close Grip)
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your back to a stable surface, such as a preacher curl bench or a rowing machine.
2. Adjust the height of the bench so that your arms are held at a comfortable position, with your upper arms resting on the pad and your elbows flexed at approximately 90 degrees.
3. Hold a dumbbell in each hand with your palms facing forward (towards you).
4. Focus on squeezing your biceps as you curl the dumbbells up towards your shoulders, without moving your upper arms.
5. Lower the dumbbells back to the starting position by straightening your elbows, keeping your core engaged and avoiding swinging or jerking movements.
short_summary: Reverse preacher curls are an arm exercise that targets the biceps, performed using dumbbells and a stable surface for support.
